body.p:
The undersigned States that he has heard what he thinks and regard as all the legitimate evidences & circumstances attendant on the case of the Commonwealth of Ky. agt John J. McAfee for now pending in the Jessamine Circuit Court for alledged shooting at Wm McDowell with intent to kill in the town of Nicholasville on the 5th day of August 1861 -- & ^in^ his judgement & opinion he considers & regards the Bail of said McAfee of $4000 -- as fined by the examining Court at his trial -- as an excessive & exorbitant Bail -- & he further thinks from evidences & manifestations in the Community both before & Since his said trial & up to the present time-that the personnal appearance of said McAfee in this Community on account of the prejudice & excitement against him would be accompanied with hazard & peril of his life
Nicholasville Ky
Septr 17. 1861 --

H. J. Campbell Presiding Judge
Jessamine County Court
